abstract: Google and Verizon plan to make Android handsets and other devices that do things on Verizon’s network that Android phones on other networks can’t do.
snippet: Google and Verizon plan to make Android handsets and other devices that do things on Verizon’s network that Android phones on other networks can’t do.
lead_paragraph: Being open doesn’t mean being ordinary, at least in the construction of Lowell C. McAdam, the chief executive of Verizon Wireless.

headline.main: Verizon O.K. With Competition From Android Apps
